conclusion: Shadows form due to the blocking of light by an object. The position and size of the shadow depend on the relative positions of the light source, the object, and the surface on which the shadow is cast.
When the light source moves, the length and direction of the shadow will change.

premise: If the light source moves backward (away from the objects), it will affect both the position and size of the shadows.
conclusion: Shadows will get shorter and move closer to the objects as the light source moves backward.
